solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\times\pi \times _{j}_ \times _{l}_ + 2 \pi \times _{k}_ \times _{l}_ + 2(\pi \times _{j}_^2 - \pi \times _{k}_^2)\)
= _{{((2*pi_val*j*l)+(2*pi_val*k*l)+2*((pi_val*(j**2))-(pi_val*(k**2))))}}_\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= _{{((2*pi_val*j*l)+(2*pi_val*k*l)+2*((pi_val*(j**2))-(pi_val*(k**2))))}}_ \times 0.2\)
= Rs._{{((2*pi_val*j*l)+(2*pi_val*k*l)+2*((pi_val*(j**2))-(pi_val*(k**2))))*Decimal('0.2')}}_

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of _{j}_ cm and an inner diameter of _{k}_ cm. Its length is _{l}_ cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost, in Rupees, of painting the pipe?
